item.title: merkle tree
item.description: TIL about the merkle tree data structure, a tree structure in which each leaf node is a hash of a block of data, and each non-leaf node is a hash of its children. Label ROOT Value H(H01 + H23) / \ Label [H01] [H23] Value H(H0 + H1) H(H2 + H3) / \ / \ Label [H0] [H1] [H2] [H3] Value H(A) H(B) H(C) H(D) | | | | A B C D It’s mostly used in distributed systems for efficient data verification since it only depends on hashes instead of full files.
